description:
Demolition of garages and redevelopment of the site by the
erection of a two storey side extension to provide a
residential unit together with two car parking spaces
utilising the existing means of access from the highway,
as shown by drawing numbers 1045 (PL-OS) 01, (PL-EX) 02, 03,
04, 05, 06, 07, (PL-PR) 08, 09, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and
letter dated 26th November 2001 from ACS  Consulting Tree
Management.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials (
    including the submission of samples of materials) to be used
    on the extension shall not be otherwise than as shall have
    been submitted to and approved by the Council before any
    work on the site is commenced. The extension shall not be
    implemented otherwise than in accordance with the approved
    details.

Condition : 2 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping (including new tree planting, the
    treatment of the car parking areas and the proposed site
    boundary walls and gates) have been submitted to and
    approved by the Council. The development shall not be
    carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved
    details.

Condition : 3 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    following planting season, with others of similar size and
    species, unless the Council gives written consent to any
    variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details, prior to the occupation for the permitted
    use of the development or any phase of the development,
    whichever is the sooner. Any trees or areas of planting
    which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the
    development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or
    diseased, shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably
    possible and, in any case, by not later than the end of the

Condition : 4 - All trees on the site, or parts of trees growing from
    approved by the Council before any works are commenced on
    site. The development shall not be carried out otherwise
    than in accordance with the approved details.
    adjoining sites, unless shown on the permitted drawings as
    being removed, shall be retained and protected from damage
    to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least
    12 months following the completion of the development hereby
    approved, or such longer period as may be required under
    Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act
    1990. Details of a method statement for the protection of
    trees to be retained on the site shall be submitted to and

Condition : 5 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building only.

Condition : 6 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - To enable the Council to ensure a reasonable standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 8 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard of
    visual amenity in the scheme in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN15 and EN35 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 9 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area in accordance with the requirements of policies
    EN61 and EN35 of the London Borough of Camden Unitary
    Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 11 - The proposed boundary treatment comprising brick wall and
    timber fencing is unacceptable and not hereby approved. The
    Council would not object to a totally brick boundary
    treatment and would ask that such details are submitted as
    part of the discharge of Condition 2.
